com.cyc.baseclient.datatype

Class CycStringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtils

  • public class CycStringUtils
extends Object
    Provides String utilities not otherwise provided by Violin Strings. All methods are static. There is no need to instantiate this class.

    Version:
    $Id: CycStringUtils.java 175790 2017-11-08 02:44:55Z nwinant $
    Author:
    Stephen L. Reed

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(String string)
        Returns true iff all characters in the given string are numeric. A prefix character of "+" or "-" is accepted as numeric. Decimal points are not accepted as numeric by this method.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to be tested
        Returns:
        true iff all characters are numeric

      • unicodeEscaped

        public static String unicodeEscaped(String str)

      • unicodeEscaped

        public static String unicodeEscaped(String str,
                                    boolean isApi)
        Returns the Subl escaped string representing the input string Each character that is not 7 bit ASCII and ASCII control characters are escaped in the following form where xxxx is the hex representation of the character (it may be from 2 to 6 hex digits as needed). The escaped representation is then &uxxxx; The semicolon at the end is required. Also '&' is escaped to &u26;
        Parameters:
        str - The string to be converted.
        isApi -
        Returns:
        the unicode escaped string.

      • toPrettyMessage

        public static List<String> toPrettyMessage(Throwable t,
                                           String firstIndent,
                                           String restIndent,
                                           int wrapLength,
                                           boolean includeThrowableClass,
                                           boolean includeStackElement)
        Pretty-prints the top-most error message from a Throwable with word-wrap and indenting. For example: 
        
 > CycApiException: com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtilsTest.getMockException(StringUtilsTest.java:254)
   Important CycApiException: Here's a Cyc API exception...
   which spans multiple lines
        Or: 
        
 +-Important CycApiException: Here's a Cyc API exception...
 |-which spans multiple lines

        To recursively print the error message from a Throwable and all of its causes, see the toPrettyMessages(java.lang.Throwable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, boolean, boolean) method.

        The result is returned as a list of strings, with each string representing one line, making it easy to feed to a logger. The list can also be fed to a PrintStream or a Writer via printlns(java.util.Collection, java.io.PrintStream) or write(java.util.Collection, java.io.Writer, boolean), respectively, and of course can easily be concatenated back into a single String by using something like org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.join(list, "\n")

        Parameters:
        t - the Throwable to pretty-print
        firstIndent - the string which is prepended to the first line
        restIndent - the string which is prepended to all subsequent lines
        wrapLength - the column to wrap the words at, less than 1 disables word wrap
        includeThrowableClass - whether to include the classname of the Throwable
        includeStackElement - whether to include the Throwable's first stack element
        Returns:
        a list of strings, one string per line
        See Also:
        DISABLE_WORD_WRAP, toPrettyMessages(java.lang.Throwable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, boolean, boolean), printlns(java.util.Collection, java.io.PrintStream), write(java.util.Collection, java.io.Writer, boolean)

      • toPrettyMessage

        public static List<String> toPrettyMessage(Throwable t,
                                           int wrapLength,
                                           boolean includeThrowableClass,
                                           boolean includeStackElement)
        Pretty-prints the top-most error message from a Throwable with word-wrap and indenting.
        Parameters:
        t -
        wrapLength -
        includeThrowableClass -
        includeStackElement -
        Returns:
        a list of pretty-printed error messages
        See Also:
        toPrettyMessage(java.lang.Throwable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, boolean, boolean)

        Returns:

      • toPrettyMessages

        public static List<String> toPrettyMessages(Throwable t,
                                            String firstIndent,
                                            String restIndent,
                                            int wrapLength,
                                            boolean includeThrowableClass,
                                            boolean includeStackElement)
        Recursively pretty-prints the error messages from a Throwable and all of its causes, with word-wrap and indenting. For example: 
        
 > CycApiException: com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtilsTest.getMockException(StringUtilsTest.java:254)
   Important CycApiException: Here's a Cyc API exception...
   which spans multiple lines
   > UnsupportedOperationException: com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtilsTest.getMockException(StringUtilsTest.java:252)
     Which wraps an UnsupportedOperationException
     > SQLException: com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtilsTest.getMockException(StringUtilsTest.java:246)
       And here's a random SQL exception...
       ... whose message spans...
       (some really very extremely and deliberately excessively over-verbose and ridiculously long lines which just keep going
       and going and going for...)
       ... multiple lines!
       > NullPointerException: com.cyc.baseclient.datatype.CycStringUtilsTest.getMockException(StringUtilsTest.java:245)
         And finally, some random NullPointerException.
        Or: 
        
 +-Important CycApiException: Here's a Cyc API exception...
 |---which spans multiple lines
   +-Which wraps an UnsupportedOperationException
     +-And here's a random SQL exception...
     |---... whose message spans...
     |---(some really very extremely and deliberately
     |---excessively over-verbose and ridiculously long lines
     |---which just keep going and going and going for...)
     |---... multiple lines!
       +-And finally, some random NullPointerException.

        To pretty-print only the top-most error message from a Throwable, see the toPrettyMessage(java.lang.Throwable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, boolean, boolean) method.

        The result is returned as a list of strings, with each string representing one line, making it easy to feed to a logger. The list can also be fed to a PrintStream or a Writer via printlns(java.util.Collection, java.io.PrintStream) or write(java.util.Collection, java.io.Writer, boolean), respectively, and of course can easily be concatenated back into a single String by using something like org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.join(list, "\n")

        Parameters:
        t - the Throwable to pretty-print
        firstIndent - the string which is prepended to the first line
        restIndent - the string which is prepended to each subsequent line
        wrapLength - the column to wrap the words at, less than 1 disables word wrap
        includeThrowableClass - whether to include the classname of the Throwable
        includeStackElement - whether to include the Throwable's first stack element
        Returns:
        a list of strings, one string per line
        See Also:
        DISABLE_WORD_WRAP, toPrettyMessage(java.lang.Throwable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, boolean, boolean), printlns(java.util.Collection, java.io.PrintStream), write(java.util.Collection, java.io.Writer, boolean)

      • toPrettyMessages

                                            int wrapLength,
                                            boolean includeThrowableClass,
                                            boolean includeStackElement)

        includeThrowableClass -
        includeStackElement -
        Returns:
        a list of pretty-printed error messages
        See Also:
